column4: hey, so I've got a question about how the LiveCD creates what it sees as a « hard drive »
(I'm trying to figure out if I've got a bad memory slot or bad firmware, and this may be the solution.)
but I installed two 4GB SODIMMs and it's telling me it only sees one
even after flipping them
however, when I loaded up the live cd, it said I had 3.6GiB of RAM, and 3.9GB of disk space
that looks mysteriously similar to a full 8GB of RAM installed to me.
well tmpfs has a max size limit
you mean the temp file system?
sort of, I guess.
oh? booting issues?
no booting issues
were you using a 32x cd?
no, AMD64
that answered my question, I think. The answer isn't pretty, but that's what I was wondering about.
yeah, definitely. I just want to be sure that's what's up
http://www.kernel.org/pub/linux/kernel/people/marcelo/linux-2.4/Documentation/filesystems/tmpfs.txt
osx couldn't read >4gb o_O
I think it's an EFI problem
oh
weird
in a word, yes. This was happening before, too, I discovered … when I cracked the case, expecting to see one DIMM, and saw two.
thanks for the help!
